However, WBV did not affect amyloid plaque load and only showed a tendency to improve motor performance in wild-type mice.
population_specificity: Five-month-old male J20 mice (n=26) and their wild-type littermates (n=24).
effective_dosage: 2 WBV sessions of 10 min per day, five days per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of whole-body vibration training on lower limb motor function in children with cerebral palsy through a meta-analysis of randomized-controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that whole-body vibration training significantly improved several measures of lower limb motor function (GMFM88-D, GMFM88-E, TUG, BBS, and ankle joint range of motion) in children with cerebral palsy, though it did not significantly improve 6MWT walking speed.
population_specificity: Children with cerebral palsy

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Whole-Body Vibration (WBV) affects motor unit recruitment threshold and discharge rate in the tibialis anterior muscle.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in motor unit recruitment threshold or discharge rate after WBV compared to control conditions, suggesting no acute neuromuscular effects under the tested protocol.
population_specificity: 14 healthy men (25 ± 2.3 years; BMI = 23.3 ± 1.5 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: Not specified (vibration applied via platform targeting the tibialis anterior).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of whole-body vibration training (WBVT) on oxidative stress markers, plasma irisin levels, and body composition in women with fibromyalgia (FM).
results_summary: After 6 weeks of WBVT, the intervention group showed higher irisin levels, lower TBARS levels (indicating reduced oxidative stress), and reduced visceral adipose tissue mass compared to the untrained group. These results suggest WBVT improves redox status and body composition in women with FM.
population_specificity: Women with fibromyalgia (n=40).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of whole-body vibration exercise (WBVE) on metabolic syndrome (MSy) individuals, focusing on physical, functional, psychosocial, neuromuscular, and emotional parameters.
results_summary: The study found positive effects of WBVE on flexibility, cardiovascular responses, neuromuscular activation, and body composition, with weighted mean differences indicating significant improvements. However, long-term effects remain unclear, necessitating further research.
population_specificity: Individuals with metabolic syndrome (MSy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of single and 12-week WBVT on hemorheological blood indices and plasma fibrinogen levels in young, healthy women, comparing it to exercise without vibration and no intervention.
results_summary: WBVT led to a significant decrease in mean erythrocyte volume and hemoglobin mass, a slight increase in mean erythrocyte hemoglobin concentration, and improved erythrocyte deformability at low shear stress. The study confirmed WBVT improves blood flow without affecting erythrocyte aggregation or fibrinogen levels, indicating safety.
population_specificity: Young, healthy women (n = 17 in WBVT group, n = 12 in exercise-only group, n = 17 in control group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole-body vibration (WBV) and aerobic exercise on hormonal profiles and inflammatory status in women with premenstrual syndrome (PMS).
results_summary: WBV and aerobic exercise both had positive effects on PMS symptoms, but WBV showed statistically significant improvements in cortisol, progesterone, prolactin, and estradiol levels compared to aerobic exercise. No significant differences were found in PMS symptom scores or inflammatory markers between the two interventions.
population_specificity: 105 women diagnosed with premenstrual syndrome (PMS).
effective_dosage: WBV training three times per week (specific vibration parameters not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review clinical trials from the last 10 years to evaluate the effects of Whole-Body Vibration therapy on osteoporotic women and the elderly for treating bone degenerative diseases and posture/gait issues.
results_summary: The study found that Whole-Body Vibration therapy shows potential in restoring bone mass and improving posture control and gait in osteoporotic women and the elderly, though optimal treatment parameters (frequency, amplitude, duration, intensity) remain undetermined.
population_specificity: Osteoporotic women and the elderly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of Whole-Body Vibration (WBV) for post-stroke spasticity and determine optimal application conditions.
results_summary: WBV combined with conventional rehabilitation at frequencies below 20 Hz was effective in reducing upper and lower limb spasticity, particularly in patients under 60 years with acute/subacute stroke. No serious adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with post-stroke spasticity, specifically those under 60 years with acute or subacute stroke.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of whole-body vibration training on improving balance and walking function in stroke patients.
results_summary: The meta-analysis demonstrated significant improvements in step length, step speed, cadence, stride length, Berg Balance Scale, Timed Up-and-Go test, 10-meter Walk Test, functional ambulation category scale, and Fugl-Meyer motor assessment of lower extremity. Subgroup analysis indicated that 20-30 Hz frequency showed notable improvement in TUGT.
population_specificity: Patients with stroke suffering from balance and walking dysfunction.
effective_dosage: 20-30 Hz frequency (specific dosage details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various interventions, including Whole-Body Vibration, in treating sarcopenia, focusing on muscle mass, strength, and physical performance.
results_summary: Whole-Body Vibration was included in the analysis but was not ranked among the most effective interventions for increasing muscle mass, strength, or physical performance compared to mixed exercise or physical activity with nutritional supplementation.
population_specificity: Participants with sarcopenia in any setting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whole-body vibration therapy as a potential future management option for muscle weakness in children with neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1).
results_summary: The abstract mentions that trials involving whole-body vibration therapy are underway, but no results or findings are provided.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1) experiencing muscle weakness.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of stochastic whole-body vibration (WBV) on ataxia symptoms in patients with spinocerebellar ataxia types 1, 2, 3, and 6 (SCA 1, 2, 3, and 6).
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in gait, posture, and speech speed in the verum group, but no effect on limb kinetics or ataxia of speech. Stochastic WBV may act on proprioceptive mechanisms and stimulate non-cerebellar compensatory pathways, though the exact cellular mechanisms remain unclear.
population_specificity: Patients with spinocerebellar ataxia types 1, 2, 3, and 6 (SCA 1, 2, 3, and 6).
effective_dosage: Five stimulus trains of 60-s duration at 6.5 Hz, with 60-s rest between stimuli, administered over four consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 6 months of whole-body vibration (WBV) training, alone or combined with vitamin D supplementation, improves balance, functionality, and fall risk in institutionalized elderly women.
results_summary: WBV training significantly improved endurance capacity, walking speed, and TUG performance compared to vitamin D supplementation alone, but showed no additional benefit for fall risk or postural control. High-dose vitamin D was not more effective than conventional dosing for any parameter.
population_specificity: Institutionalized elderly women (mean age 79.6).
effective_dosage: WBV training 3×/week (specific vibration parameters not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the effects of stochastic whole-body vibration (WBV) on motor symptoms in Parkinson's disease patients compared to a sham treatment.
results_summary: The study found that stochastic WBV improved bradykinesia in 77.8% of patients and postural stability in 44.4%, with a 26.7% improvement in UPDRSIII sum score, though some outcomes did not reach statistical significance. Speech and facial expression remained unchanged.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease.
effective_dosage: 5 cycles of stochastic WBV (5 stimulus trains of 60 seconds each at 6.5 Hz, with 60 seconds rest between stimuli) on three days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the estrogenic activity and cellular effects of wild yam extract on MCF-7 human breast cancer cells.
results_summary: Wild yam extract showed weak phytoestrogenic activity by increasing progesterone receptor and pS2 gene activity, though less prominently than 17beta-estradiol. It also down-regulated estrogen receptor alpha protein and inhibited MCF-7 cell proliferation.
population_specificity: MCF-7 human breast cancer cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether Dioscorea villosa (wild yam) extract causes renal toxicity and fibrosis in vivo, as previously observed in vitro.
results_summary: The study found no acute kidney or liver toxicity but observed increased kidney fibrosis and liver inflammation in rats after 28 days of treatment. Long-term use of wild yam may pose risks, especially for individuals with compromised renal function.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Whole-Body Vibration (WBV) training, combined with conventional or high-dose vitamin D supplementation, improves strength, muscle mass, and bone density in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: WBV training did not provide additional improvements in muscle mass, strength, or hip bone mineral density compared to vitamin D supplementation alone. High-dose vitamin D increased serum levels but did not enhance musculoskeletal outcomes over conventional doses.
population_specificity: Institutionalized elderly women aged over 70 years (mean age 79.6).
effective_dosage: WBV training protocol not specified; vitamin D doses were 880 IU/day (conventional) and 1600 IU/day (high).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the bitter and toxic principles in four wild yam species consumed by Nepali aborigines and assess their safety and palatability after traditional treatment.
results_summary: The study found that the wild yams contained furanoid norditerpenes (diosbulbins A and B) as bitter components but lacked toxic alkaloids like dioscorine and histamine. Cyanogen levels were below safety limits, and domestic cooking effectively reduced bitterness.
population_specificity: Tribal people in Nepal who consume wild yams.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and potential toxicity of Dioscorea Villosa (Wild Yam) Root Extract in cosmetic formulations and its possible metabolic/endocrine activity.
results_summary: The study found that Wild Yam extract prepared with ≤3.5% diosgenin showed no estrogenic activity, minimal toxicity in acute and short-term tests, and no genotoxicity except for one inconsistent Ames test result. Undiluted extract caused skin irritation, but diluted forms (e.g., 10%) were non-irritating and safe for cosmetic use.
population_specificity: Rats, rabbits, and guinea pigs (animal models).
effective_dosage: Up to 2 g/kg (oral), 10% (dermal), and 500 mg/kg/day (uterotrophic assay).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and test a new fluorescent probe (NPD-H2S) for detecting hydrogen sulfide (H2S) in environmental samples, including wine, and living systems.
results_summary: The probe demonstrated superior performance in detecting H2S in wine and environmental water samples, with high sensitivity, selectivity, and fast response. It was also effective for bioimaging H2S in cells, zebrafish, and plants under salt stress.
population_specificity: Environmental samples (water, wine), HeLa cells, MCF-7 cells, zebrafish, and Arabidopsis thaliana.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of topical wild yam extract in managing menopausal symptoms in women.
results_summary: The study found no significant side effects from wild yam cream but also no statistically significant difference in symptom relief compared to placebo. Minor improvements in some symptoms were noted, but these were not clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: 23 healthy women with troublesome menopausal symptoms, average age 53.3 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the historical trajectory, research hotspots, and treatment outcomes for port wine stains (PWS) through scientometric analysis and meta-analysis.
results_summary: The study found that treatment outcomes for PWS improved from 2000 to 2023, with pulsed dye laser (PDL) and photodynamic therapy (PDT) being the primary modalities, though preferences varied between China and Western countries. Genetic discoveries suggest potential future therapeutic breakthroughs.
population_specificity: Patients with port wine stains (PWS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the mechanism by which red wine consumption decreases hepcidin levels and its potential effects on iron homeostasis.
results_summary: The study found that consuming 300 ml of red wine for 3 weeks decreased serum hepcidin and increased erythropoietin levels, suggesting activation of the erythropoietin-erythroferrone-hepcidin pathway. These effects were observed in both healthy individuals and those with type 2 diabetes.
population_specificity: Apparently healthy individuals (n = 13) and subjects with type 2 diabetes (n = 18).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether X-ray and electron beam irradiation could enhance the extraction of phenolic and aromatic compounds in wine.
results_summary: Irradiation significantly increased phenolic compound extraction and antioxidant activity (up to 38.98% and 38.70% for DPPH and ABTS, respectively). Wines treated with 0.5 kGy electron beams showed the highest levels of esters and higher alcohols, improving fruity aromas while reducing green notes.
population_specificity: Grapes (not human subjects)

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the efficacy and safety of hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether mediated photodynamic therapy (HMME-PDT) in treating children with port-wine stains (PWS).
results_summary: The study found that HMME-PDT showed promising therapeutic efficacy in children with PWS, with more than half achieving significant improvement (≥60%). Common adverse effects included edema, purpura, crust, hyperpigmentation, and rare cases of scarring or hypopigmentation.
population_specificity: Children with port-wine stains (PWS), specifically aged 0-18 years.
study_duration: Treatment course of ≥3 sessions showed better outcomes compared to 1 or 2 sessions (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the effectiveness of iron oxide-silica core-shell nanomaterial functionalized with TiO2 in modulating UV-C treatment effects on yeast viability and polyphenol content in white and red wines.
results_summary: The study found that the nanomaterial could modulate UV-C treatment effects on yeast viability and polyphenol content, with effectiveness varying by wine type. The results suggest potential for using this hurdle technology in winemaking to control polyphenol composition and alcohol reduction.
population_specificity: Muscaris and Cabernet Cortis wines, with Saccharomyces cerevisiae as a model yeast.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal ripening time for Japanese apricot fruit and the best conditions for producing steeped mume wine, focusing on aroma and nutritional components.
results_summary: The study found that the optimal aroma and nutritional period for the fruit was 81 days after flowering, and using a 65%vol base wine best preserved these qualities in the steeped mume wine. Microwave aging at 500 W, 50 °C for 80 min improved aroma components by increasing esters and reducing acids.
population_specificity: Japanese apricot fruit ('Nannong Longxia') and steeped mume wine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of stochastic resonance whole-body vibration (SR-WBV) on improving balance in the elderly, particularly as a simple and time-efficient therapeutic procedure to reduce falls.
results_summary: Six out of nine studies showed statistically significant improvements in balance after SR-WBV interventions, with one study noting clinical relevance in the "Expanded Time to Get Up and Go Test." Two studies focusing on reactive balance also reported statistically significant improvements.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals at risk of falls.
effective_dosage: Vibration frequency ranged from 1 to 12 Hz (specific dosage details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether multi-frequency ultrasonic treatment could accelerate the maturation and enhance the flavor profile of traditional Chinese rice wine.
results_summary: Ultrasonic treatment (40 kHz, 50 W/L, 30 °C, 15 min) increased total esters by 7.3% and volatile esters by 286.78% after six months, while reducing volatile alcohols and aldehydes and increasing volatile acids. The study linked these changes to ultrasonic-induced free radicals and acoustic cavitation.
population_specificity: Traditional Chinese rice wine samples.
study_duration: 15 min of sonication, followed by 180 days of aging.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the oxidative coupling of resveratrol and piceid in wine, their temperature-dependent polymerization, and their anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: The study found that resveratrol and piceid transformed into dimers (δ-viniferin and δ-viniferin-diglucoside) during heat treatment, with higher conversion rates at elevated temperatures. Piceid was more reactive than resveratrol in wine, and the anti-inflammatory effects of these compounds were evaluated on a macrophage cell line.
population_specificity: RAW 264.7 macrophage cell line (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of various treatments, including low-temperature plasma, on the physicochemical properties and quality maintenance of tea wine during storage.
results_summary: Tea wine treated with low-temperature plasma (LTPS) showed superior quality maintenance, higher tea polyphenol content, and enhanced fruity and sweet aroma due to increased alcohols and esters (89.72%) compared to untreated, UV-treated, and HTHP-treated tea wine.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on tea wine samples, not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (study examined treatment effects, not dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify urinary biomarkers of regular wine consumption in free-living volunteers without dietary intervention.
results_summary: The study found sixteen compounds in urine samples from regular wine consumers that were absent in non-consumers, along with higher concentrations of phenol metabolites, mainly hepatic phase-II conjugates, in wine consumers.
population_specificity: Adults aged 52-78 from La Rioja, Spain, including moderate and daily wine consumers (20 males, 13 females) and non-consumers (8 males, 35 females).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different fermentation treatments (spontaneous fermentation, direct inoculation of CECA, and inoculation with CECA after antimicrobial treatment) on the metabolite composition and sensory attributes of wine.
results_summary: CECA inoculation significantly influenced the composition of 141 metabolites, including volatile and non-volatile compounds, and was more favorable to certain sensory attributes like aftertaste-A, umami, sourness, and richness. Antimicrobial treatment enhanced bitterness, astringency, umami, and saltiness while reducing acidity.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely wine fermentation processes, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the efficacy and safety of the 595-nm pulsed dye laser (PDL) for treating pediatric port-wine birthmarks (PWB) and infantile hemangiomas (IH).
results_summary: The study found that PDL showed high efficacy, with good to complete clearance reported in 89% of PWB cases and 100% of IH cases, and very low rates of permanent adverse effects (0.8% for PWB and 0.2% for IH).
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with port-wine birthmarks (PWB) or infantile hemangiomas (IH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether processing Coptis deltoidea (CD) with wine reduces its gastrointestinal damage and bitter-cold properties while exploring potential mechanisms.
results_summary: Processing CD with wine (PCD) reduced gastrointestinal damage, inflammatory factors, and NF-κB p65 expression compared to unprocessed CD. PCD also induced milder gut microbiota dysregulation and maintained higher short-chain fatty acid levels.
population_specificity: Mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between urinary tartaric acid (an objective biomarker of wine consumption) and cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk in a high-risk Mediterranean population.
results_summary: Light-to-moderate wine consumption (3-35 glasses/month), measured via urinary tartaric acid, was associated with lower CVD risk, while self-reported wine consumption showed less significant associations.
population_specificity: Mediterranean adults at high cardiovascular risk (n=1232, including 685 incident CVD cases).
effective_dosage: ∼3-35 glasses/month (reflected by urinary tartaric acid concentrations of 3-35 μg/mL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of different laser- and light-based treatments for port-wine birthmarks (PWB) in infants.
results_summary: Hemoporfin-mediated photodynamic therapy was more effective in lesion clearance than pulsed dye laser (PDL) but had the highest risk of adverse events (AEs). The 755 nm alexandrite laser and the combination of 595 nm PDL + 1064 nm Nd:YAG also showed high AE risks, though discontinuation rates due to AEs did not significantly differ.
population_specificity: Infants with port-wine birthmarks (PWB).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical efficacy and adverse reactions of 595nm pulsed dye laser (PDL) for treating pediatric port-wine stains (PWS) and identify factors influencing treatment outcomes.
results_summary: The study found an overall efficacy rate of 65.3%, with higher efficacy in females, adolescents, limb lesions, and smaller lesions. Adverse reactions were minimal (4.31%), including pigmentation changes and hypopigmentation.
population_specificity: 974 pediatric patients (under 18 years) with solitary PWS and Fitzpatrick skin types II-IV.
study_duration: Retrospective study spanning 2003 to 2021 (treatment duration per patient not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Provinols™, a red wine polyphenol extract, could reduce neointimal hyperplasia and lipid deposition following stent placement in hypercholesterolemic rabbits.
results_summary: Provinols™ reduced intimal growth, thickness, and surface area in stented arteries, as well as lipid accumulation and inflammatory response, though it did not significantly affect blood pressure or plasma cholesterol levels.
population_specificity: Hypercholesterolemic New Zealand white rabbits

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy and potential of Hematoporphyrin Monomethyl Ether-Photodynamic Therapy (HMME-PDT) as a treatment for port-wine stains (PWS).
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in the clinical appearance and sonographic features of PWS following HMME-PDT, highlighting its targeted effectiveness and promising outcomes. However, further research is needed to standardize protocols and assess long-term effects.
population_specificity: Individuals with congenital vascular malformations (port-wine stains).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify features of Sturge-Weber syndrome (SWS) associated with glaucoma onset, severity, and treatment failure.
results_summary: The study found that bilateral port-wine birthmarks, lower eyelid involvement, and choroidal hemangiomas were associated with glaucoma diagnosis in SWS patients, while leptomeningeal angiomas were not. Surgical progression was linked to lower eyelid involvement, but no factors predicted treatment failure.
population_specificity: Children with Sturge-Weber syndrome (SWS) with and without glaucoma.

study_goal: The researchers were not studying Wine; the abstract focuses on the combination of chemotherapy and endocrine therapy in breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention Wine or its effects; it discusses the antagonistic and synergistic effects of chemotherapy and endocrine therapy in breast cancer.
population_specificity: Patients with hormone receptor-positive breast cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the primary active components and molecular mechanisms behind the bioactivity of Hakka Huangjiu, focusing on its antioxidant and immunomodulatory effects.
results_summary: The study found that polysaccharide-1 (HP1) from Hakka Huangjiu exhibited dose-dependent antioxidant activity and protected HepG2 cells from oxidative damage. HP1 also induced immunomodulatory effects in RAW264.7 cells, increasing the release of inflammatory markers and mRNA expression of related genes.
population_specificity: In vitro (HepG2 and RAW264.7 cell lines)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the endophyte che218 could enhance anthocyanin biosynthesis in grape berry skins to improve coloration, mitigating the effects of global warming.
results_summary: The study found that che218 promoted anthocyanin accumulation in grape berry skins, with effects observed at 15-20 days post-treatment in two growing seasons, though results varied by timing and harvest. It also upregulated key genes (mybA1 and UFGT) involved in anthocyanin biosynthesis.
population_specificity: Grapevine berry skins (Vitis vinifera)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and analyze methods for achieving tartaric stability in wine and their effects on sensory quality.
results_summary: The study summarized various tartaric stabilization methods (cold stabilization, ion exchange, electrodialysis, and exogenous additives) and their impacts on wine quality, providing a basis for selecting appropriate stabilization techniques.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing methods and studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of thermally inactivated yeasts (TIYs) from different strains on white wine quality and stability.
results_summary: TIYs increased polysaccharide concentration, improved protein stability, reduced heat-induced haze formation, affected color parameters by adsorbing phenolic compounds, and significantly altered the wine's volatile profile, enhancing overall quality and stability.
population_specificity: White wine (no human or animal subjects mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how on-vine drying (passérillage) with different water loss rates affects the quality of wine made from Hutai No.8 table grapes.
results_summary: Moderate on-vine drying (18% water loss) improved wine quality by increasing sugar, alcohol, glycerol, phenolic compounds, and aroma compounds, leading to enhanced color and sensory characteristics. The D2 treatment (18% water loss) showed optimal results in terms of color and aroma profiles.
population_specificity: Hutai No.8 table grapes used for winemaking.
effective_dosage: Not specified (water loss rates: moderate drying at 18%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of high-hydrostatic-pressure (HHP) treatment on polyphenols and volatile aromatic compounds in Marselan red wine.
results_summary: HHP treatment at 300 MPa for 20 min significantly increased total polyphenol content (35.82% rise) and enhanced key polyphenols like resveratrol and protocatechuic acid. It also increased ester compounds, enriching floral and fruity aromas, improving the wine's sensory quality.
population_specificity: Marselan red wine (no human subjects studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of harvest timing and alcohol adjustment methods (pre- and post-fermentation) on the aroma profile of Sauvignon blanc wine.
results_summary: The study found that aroma compounds increased with higher ethanol levels and decreased with dealcoholization, except for volatile thiols, which were influenced by harvest timing. Dealcoholization was effective in altering wine aroma, with comparable aroma loss to pre-fermentation adjustments.
population_specificity: Sauvignon blanc grapes (not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Three potential alcohol levels (11%, 13%, and 15% v/v).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of wine-processed Corni Fructus combined with Astragali Radix on plasma metabolomics in diabetic nephropathy rats.
results_summary: The study found that the wine-processed herb-pair (P-CG_5) improved kidney tissue damage and metabolic disorders in diabetic nephropathy rats, significantly downregulating 26 biomarkers related to diabetic nephropathy pathways.
population_specificity: Diabetic nephropathy rats induced by high-fat diet and streptozotocin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess variability in blood vessel characteristics (density and diameter) within and between Port-Wine Birthmarks (PWBs) using optical coherence tomography (OCT).
results_summary: The study found significant variability in vessel density and diameter within and between PWBs, with consistently higher vessel density ratios in affected skin at shallow depths (0.15–0.2 mm).
population_specificity: Individuals with Port-Wine Birthmarks (PWBs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the structural differences in white oak (Quercus alba) and northern red oak (Q. rubra) that affect liquid retention in casks, particularly focusing on tylose volume and pore-filling capacity.
results_summary: The study found that white oak has sevenfold higher tylose volume filling pores compared to northern red oak, explaining why white oak casks retain liquid effectively while red oak does not. XRCT imaging was proposed as a standard method for studying these structures and future impacts like climate change on oak tyloses.
population_specificity: White oak (Quercus alba) and northern red oak (Q. rubra) wood samples.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential mechanism of Zhu-Ye-Qing wine (ZYQW) in improving cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease (CCVD) progression using network pharmacology, molecular docking, and molecular dynamics simulation.
results_summary: The study identified 249 potential targets of ZYQW and 2080 potential targets of CCVD, with key targets including MAPK3, TP53, RELA, MAPK1, and AKT1. ZYQW may be an effective and safe health food for CCVD prevention, acting through pathways like TNF signaling and lipid/atherosclerosis signaling.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or computational study, no human or animal subjects mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of black rice wine (BRW) encapsulated in hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (HAP@BRW) as an antimicrobial and antibiofilm agent against nosocomial infections.
results_summary: HAP@BRW demonstrated potent bactericidal effects against MRSA, MSSA, and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, significantly inhibited biofilm formation, and exhibited rich antioxidant properties due to polyphenolic, flavonoid, and anthocyanin content. In vitro and in vivo toxicity studies confirmed its biocompatibility.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo models, likely bacterial cultures and animal models).
effective_dosage: Not specified (maximum release of BRW was 72% within 24 hours).
study_duration: Not specified (release kinetics measured over 24 hours).
